metadata.Title: CVE-2011-3712 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
CakePHP 1.3.7 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a direct request to a .php file, which reveals the installation path in an error message, as demonstrated by dispatcher.php and certain other files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3712` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cakephp - 2.8.0-1
cakephp-scripts - 2.8.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cakephp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.0-1').
